author: Ian Shalapata
title: Golden Display In Tecumseh
text:
The OPP Golden Helmets in Tecumseh on 11 Oct. 2015. Photo by Ian Shalapata. 
By Ian Shalapata 
(TECUMSEH, ON) – The world-famous OPP Golden Helmets rode into town on Sunday to put on a free display of motorcycle precision riding. A large crowd gathered along a closed section of Tecumseh Road as the 14-strong team manoeuvred intricately through a series of professional ridership demonstrations. The OPP Golden Helmets in Tecumseh on 11 Oct. 2015. Photo by Ian Shalapata. 
The motorcycles used by the Golden Helmets are Harley Davidson Police Specials which have 1690 cc engines and weigh about 800 pounds. The synchronized performance is a display of manoeuvrability with slow speeds and balance at the top of the skill set. But, it is not without some danger in the criss-cross and thread-the-needle patterns run at high speed. The OPP Golden Helmets in Tecumseh on 11 Oct. 2015. Photo by Ian Shalapata. 
The Golden Helmets put on an average of 30 performances a year, between the officers’ regular duties with various OPP detachments or the Highway Safety Division. Each season, a nucleus of returning riders train a new cadre of replacements. Each member has a three-week training course and at least one year of regular motorcycle patrol duty experience, before joining the team. The OPP Golden Helmets in Tecumseh on 11 Oct. 2015. Photo by Ian Shalapata. 
After the show on Sunday, audience members were able to check out the bikes, talk to the officers, and the kids were given collector cards. The OPP Golden Helmets in Tecumseh on 11 Oct. 2015.
